text: Navya is a software engineer.
Navya has a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from the University of California, Riverside, graduating in June 2025.
Navya was a Student Ambassador for Bourns' College of Engineering at UCR.
Navya interned as a Software Engineering Intern at Kohl's Technology in Summer 2024.
At Kohl's, she developed a data automation tool using Java Spring and TypeScript REST APIs to streamline purchase orders.
At Kohl's, Navya did user research to find pain points her customers were facing with the data automation tool.
To respond to the painpoints, she used Apache Kafka and React to visualize data, log progress, and provide insights to users.
Navya interned at The H.Wood Group in Summer 2023
She developed her networking skills by building a TCP/IP wireless routing systems for iPads and printers.
At the H.Wood group she created an event check-in tool using Twilio API for personalized QR codes and SMS notifications.
Navya built a job management portal using JavaScript and SQL to handle venue-specific task assignments.
Navya worked as a Software Engineering Research Associate at UCR's Electrical and Computer Engineering Department from March 2023 to June 2023.
She automated the download of 30,000+ NASA satellite images daily using JavaScript, optimizing the process by 90%.
Navya built Python pipelines to migrate datasets into Google Cloud Platform storage for scalable analysis.
EcoScan is a React/Next.js web app that identifies plant names and native status from uploaded images with GPS coordinates.
EcoScan leverages a Flask backend to handle image uploads and processing.
Congressional Voting Records Analysis is a predictive analysis of US House votes using Python, with machine learning models achieving up to 98% accuracy.
Hotplate Simulation is a multithreaded C++ heat diffusion simulator, paired with a Python heatmap generator for visualization.
Guffle is a playlist generator web app using React/Next.js and Apple Music API that creates custom playlists based on user-selected filters.
UI/UX case studies include Beef/Bear web and mobile design, The HurdCo data visualization with blockchain backend, and AllTrails routing flow redesign.
Navya is skilled in Java, Python, C++, JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Node.js, Express.js, Next.js, Spring, Flask, and Tailwind CSS.
She is also experienced with SQL, Git, Agile/SCRUM, Figma, Miro, and Twilio API.
Navya enjoys hiking, rock climbing, and basketball.
She recently completed the Lake Perris Sprint Triathlon in Spring 2025 and is pursuing tri-sport as a hobby.
Navya loves movies and is a heavy Letterboxd user.

Some of her favorite movies include Wolf of Wall Street, Ratatouille, Grand Budapest Hotel, Fight Club, Tangled, Ted, 10 Things I Hate About You, Molly's Game, Whiplash, Creed, The Imitation Game, Good Will Hunting, and The Devil Wears Prada.
Navya enjoys music of many genres including Bollywood, RnB, hip-hop, pop, and alternative rock.
She has a habit of listening to one song on repeat while working to focus.
Navya has a technical interest in AI and a creative interest in product design.
Her interest in product design was inspired by the Grace Hopper Celebration in 2023, which led her to explore UI/UX and side creative projects.
Navya values building, ideating, and iterating, and enjoys the entire software development lifecycle.
She wants to combine her creative design interests with her software engineering skills.
